family.name: Mary
family.notes: Primary familial bond; depicted as faithful witness from birth narratives through the cross.

family.name: Joseph
family.notes: Davidic descendant who protects the family in infancy narratives and models obedience.

family.name: James and siblings
family.notes: Skeptical during ministry yet key leaders in Jerusalem after the resurrection.

mentors.name: John the Baptist
mentors.notes: Commissioned Jesus into public ministry and framed his message in apocalyptic repentance.

close_disciples.name: Peter
close_disciples.notes: Confesses Jesus as messiah yet misunderstands suffering path; leader in early church.

close_disciples.name: James (son of Zebedee)
close_disciples.notes: Witness to key revelations and martyr referenced in Acts.

close_disciples.name: John (son of Zebedee)
close_disciples.notes: Traditionally associated with the beloved disciple and Johannine witness.

close_disciples.name: Mary Magdalene
close_disciples.notes: Supports Jesus's ministry materially and becomes first witness in multiple gospels.

opponents.name: Pharisees and scribes
opponents.notes: Debate purity, Sabbath, and authority claims; conflicts showcase interpretations of Torah.

opponents.name: Roman prefects and client rulers
opponents.notes: Pontius Pilate and Herod Antipas interrogate and ultimately execute Jesus under treason charges.

traits.mission_focus: Announces the in-breaking kingdom of God with urgency and secrecy, calling disciples to follow on the way of the cross.
traits.miracles: Frequent healings and exorcisms that authenticate authority yet are meant to remain veiled (e.g., Gerasene demoniac, Jairus's daughter).
traits.conflicts: Clashes with religious leaders over Sabbath, purity, and temple commerce culminating in plots to kill him.
traits.death_resurrection: Portrayed as the suffering Son of Man whose crucifixion reveals divine sonship and whose empty tomb prompts fearful proclamation.
traits.eschatology: Apocalyptic discourse warns of tribulation, vigilance, and the Son of Man's imminent return.

traits.mission_focus: Depicts Jesus as the Davidic and Mosaic teacher who fulfills Scripture while forming a Torah-observant kingdom community.
traits.miracles: Signs underscore authority over nature, illness, and demonic forces while linking to fulfillment motifs.
traits.conflicts: Extended woes against Pharisees and disputes over halakha highlight Jesus as definitive interpreter of the Law.
traits.death_resurrection: Narrates cosmic portents at crucifixion and authoritative commissioning of disciples after resurrection appearances in Galilee.
traits.eschatology: Parables and the Olivet Discourse stress readiness for judgment, inclusive mission to nations, and the Son of Man's glorious arrival.

traits.mission_focus: Frames Jesus as Spirit-anointed liberator prioritizing the poor, women, and Gentiles while journeying toward Jerusalem.
traits.miracles: Emphasizes healings and restorations that manifest Jubilee reversal, such as raising the widow's son and cleansing lepers.
traits.conflicts: Prophetic laments over Jerusalem and table disputes reveal tension with elites resistant to God's visitation.
traits.death_resurrection: Highlights Jesus's innocence, forgiveness from the cross, and appearances that ground witness and table fellowship.
traits.eschatology: Balances imminence with patience, urging watchfulness amid persecution and hope for redemption.

traits.mission_focus: Portrays Jesus as the incarnate Logos revealing the Father through signs that evoke belief and abiding life.
traits.miracles: Select 'signs' such as Cana, healing the blind, and raising Lazarus unveil glory and provoke decision.
traits.conflicts: Dialogues with Judean leaders center on identity, testimony, and divine origin, escalating toward arrest.
traits.death_resurrection: Cross is enthronement where the Lamb completes mission; resurrection appearances recommission disciples with Spirit.
traits.eschatology: Presents realized eternal life now while promising future resurrection and Spirit-paraclete guidance.

traits.mission_focus: Risen Jesus inaugurates worldwide witness from Jerusalem to Rome, directing apostles through Spirit guidance.
traits.miracles: Post-resurrection appearances and ascension, along with signs through apostles, validate his ongoing authority.
traits.conflicts: Opposition from Sanhedrin and Herodian rulers is framed as resistance to the enthroned Messiah.
traits.death_resurrection: Proclaimed boldly in apostolic speeches as God's vindication that enthrones Jesus as Lord and Christ.
traits.eschatology: Ascension promises future return, motivating communal perseverance amid mission expansion.

traits.mission_focus: Visionary Christ walks among churches, calls for overcoming, and directs prophetic witness against imperial idolatry.
traits.miracles: Depicted as Lamb who opens seals, shepherds nations, and enacts cosmic judgments.
traits.conflicts: Faces the dragon, beastly powers, and false prophets, urging saints to resist assimilation.
traits.death_resurrection: Slain-yet-standing Lamb's sacrifice ransoms multitudes and grounds final victory.
traits.eschatology: Returns as warrior-king, ushers final judgment, and renews creation with New Jerusalem.

traits.mission_focus: Proclaims crucified and risen Lord to Jew and Gentile alike, forming Spirit-led communities through apostolic correspondence.
traits.miracles: References signs and wonders accompanying mission though secondary to the preached cross.
traits.conflicts: Debates over Torah observance, table-fellowship, and apostolic legitimacy highlight cross-shaped leadership.
traits.death_resurrection: Centers gospel on atoning death and resurrection appearances that ground justification and hope.
traits.eschatology: Anticipates imminent parousia while teaching resurrection bodies and transformative hope.

traits.mission_focus: Presents Jesus as exalted Son and heavenly high priest mediating a better covenant through obedient suffering.
traits.miracles: Emphasis on completed sacrificial work and testimonies confirmed by signs received from witnesses.
traits.conflicts: Warns against apostasy by contrasting Jesus's priesthood with Levitical system and unbelief of wilderness generation.
traits.death_resurrection: Highlights perfection through suffering, once-for-all sacrifice, and enthronement at God's right hand.
traits.eschatology: Encourages persevering pilgrimage toward the unshakable kingdom and heavenly city.
